title: Tony Dungy
summary: Anthony Kevin Dungy (/ˈdʌndʒi/ DUN-jee; born October 6, 1955) is a sports analyst and former American football safety and coach, who served as a head coach in the National Football League (NFL) for 13 seasons with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Indianapolis Colts. Dungy's teams became perennial postseason contenders under his leadership, missing the playoffs only twice with Tampa Bay. He led the Colts to victory in Super Bowl XLI, making him the first black head coach to win the Super Bowl.[1]
